content.rendered:
What is an Animal Scientist?

Animal Scientists conduct research concerning domesticated animals to better understand their growth, genetics, and other processes. They are also concerned with quality and quantity of food supply.

Where does an Animal Scientist work?

  • Government
  • Research labs
  • Animal production services

How much does an Animal Scientist make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for an Animal Scientist is $21,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Animal Scientists?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Agricultural majors
  • Food science majors
  • Biology majors
Search relevant jobs

Animal Scientist skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Animal Scientists succeed in their work:

  • Passion for research and innovation
  • Strong communication skills
  • Good leadership and teamwork skills

What are some common questions about Animal Scientists?

Q: What’s the difference between Animal Scientists and Zoologists?

A: While Animal Scientists are concerned with domesticated animals, Zoologists’ area of study spans to all animals.
